description: Based on user-provided information, this program was described as offering $32.50/kW payment for participation with 1 scheduled event (1 hour) and up to 4 unscheduled events (max 4 hours each). However, extensive research could not verify the existence of this specific program or confirm these program details through official Entergy Texas sources.

customer_classes.size_threshold_notes: User-provided information indicated 250 kW minimum, but this could not be verified through official sources

capacity_rate.unit: unknown - per season, per year, or other period not specified
capacity_rate.notes: User-provided information indicated $32.50/kW payment, but the time period (per season, per year, per month, etc.) could not be determined through research

event_parameters.notes: User-provided information indicated 1 scheduled event (1 hour duration) plus up to 4 unscheduled events (max 4 hours each), totaling 5 events maximum per year. This could not be verified through official sources.

data_sources.notes: DataLink is described as a load management and reporting tool with 30-minute interval data. No specific program payment or event structure details were available on this page.
Page lists various rate riders including MVDR (Market Valued Demand Response Rider) and IS (Interruptible Service Rider), but PDF tariff documents were not accessible through web research tools.
General statement that 'Business customers can earn cash incentives for reducing electric use during peak demand periods' but no specific program details, payment rates, or event structures provided.
Reference found in search results but document was not accessible (DNS resolution failed).
Reference found in search results but document was not accessible (DNS resolution failed).
URL resulted in 301 redirect and subsequent 404 error. Page no longer exists at this location.

integration_metadata.notes: CRITICAL DATA QUALITY ISSUE: Despite 30+ minutes of extensive research across multiple sources, the specific Load Management Program described by the user (with $32.50/kW payment, 250 kW minimum, 1 scheduled + 4 unscheduled events) could not be verified through any official Entergy Texas sources. Research findings: 1) Original URL provided returns 404 error, 2) Load Management Handbook PDFs (2022 and 2025) could not be accessed due to DNS resolution failures, 3) Tariff PDFs (MVDR, IS) were not readable through web research tools, 4) No publicly indexed information contains the specific program parameters mentioned ($32.50/kW, event structure), 5) Entergy Texas does offer general 'cash incentives for reducing electric use during peak demand' but no specific program details are publicly available. RECOMMENDATION: This program may be discontinued, may never have existed with these specific parameters, or details may only be available through direct customer contact with Entergy Texas Business Center at 1-800-766-1648 or [email protected]. DO NOT USE THIS DATA FOR BATTERY OPTIMIZATION without first verifying program existence and details directly with Entergy Texas.

research_summary.researcher_notes: Conducted comprehensive research including: 1) Attempted to access original URL - resulted in redirect and 404 error, 2) Searched for Load Management Handbooks (2022, 2025) - found references but unable to access PDFs, 3) Located business tariff page with MVDR and IS riders - PDF documents not readable through available tools, 4) Searched PUCT Interchange system for tariff filings - no specific MVDR documents found, 5) Searched DSIRE database - no specific program details, 6) Conducted 15+ web searches with various keyword combinations - no results confirming the specific program parameters provided by user. CONCLUSION: The specific program details provided by the user ($32.50/kW, 250 kW minimum, 1 scheduled + 4 unscheduled events) cannot be verified from any publicly accessible source. Entergy Texas does appear to offer some form of load management or demand response program for business customers, but the specific structure, payment rates, and event parameters are not publicly documented in accessible formats.
research_summary.verification_status: UNVERIFIED - Program existence and all parameters could not be confirmed
research_summary.data_integrity_warning: ALL PROGRAM PARAMETERS ARE UNVERIFIED. User provided initial information but no official sources could confirm: payment rate of $32.50/kW (or time period), 250 kW minimum capacity, 1 scheduled event (1 hour), 4 unscheduled events (4 hours max each). Do not use this data for financial analysis or battery optimization without direct verification from Entergy Texas.
recommended_next_steps: Contact Entergy Texas Business Center at 1-800-766-1648
Email [email protected] to request current Load Management Program documentation
Request access to MVDR (Market Valued Demand Response) and IS (Interruptible Service) tariff schedules

Ask specifically about: payment rates per kW and time period, minimum capacity requirements, event structure (scheduled vs unscheduled), event durations and frequency limits, notification procedures, eligibility requirements
Request copies of 2024/2025 Load Management Handbook if available
Check if program has been discontinued or replaced with different demand response offerings
